  <strong style="display: block;">

  </strong>

  <label><input type="radio" name="module4_mcq_q84" value="A"> A. CAPM assumes only the risk-free rate matters, so hedging is irrelevant.</label><br>

  <label><input type="radio" name="module4_mcq_q84" value="C"> C. The market risk premium is reduced when commodities are included in the portfolio.</label><br>
  <label><input type="radio" name="module4_mcq_q84" value="D"> D. Firm-specific hedging eliminates systematic risk completely.</label><br>
  <label><input type="radio" name="module4_mcq_q84" value="E"> E. Portfolio diversification—by combining negatively correlated assets, investors can reduce exposure to systematic risk factors.</label><br>
